com.samysadi.acs.core.entity

Interface Entity

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable, Notifier, Probed
    All Known Subinterfaces:

    public interface Entity
extends Notifier, Probed, Cloneable
    This interface describes a simulation entity.

    A simulation entity has one parent and can have multiple children entities.
    In order to add or to remove children for this entity call the setParent(Entity) method on each child.
    Don't forget to use setParent(null) on not used entities so that they can be garbage-collected.

    All entity implementation classes should provide at least one "standard" constructor: a void (no arguments) constructor which creates an empty entity with no parent and no children.

    Since:
    1.0

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        Entity clone()
        Creates a clone of this entity and sets its parent to null.

        This is a deep clone method which also clones children entities and sets their parents to the newly created clone.

        Implementations must ensure that the new clone will be independent from the current entity.

        Specified by:
        clone in interface Notifier

      • getId

        long getId()
        Returns a unique Id describing this entity.
        Returns:
        a unique Id describing this entity

      • getName

        String getName()
        Returns the name of this entity as set using setName(String).
        Returns:
        the name of this entity

      • setName

        void setName(String name)
        Updates the name of this entity.
        Parameters:
        name -

      • getParent

        Entity getParent()
        Returns the parent of this entity, or null if no parent is set
        Returns:
        the parent of this entity, or null

      • setParent

        void setParent(Entity parent)
        Updates the parent of this entity.
        This method makes sure that the old and the new parent keep their entities list updated, by automatically calling addEntity(Entity) and removeEntity(Entity).

        A CoreNotificationCodes.ENTITY_PARENT_CHANGED notification is thrown.
        Additionally, each descendant of this entity (ie: entities who have this entity as their direct or not direct parent) are notified using CoreNotificationCodes.ENTITY_ANCESTOR_CHANGED.

        Parameters:
        parent -
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the parent was locked using lockParent().

      • hasParentRec

        boolean hasParentRec()
        Returns true if this entity has a parent (different from null) and calling hasParentRec() on the parent of this entity also returns true.
        Returns:
        true if this entity and each of its parents has a non null parent

      • lockParent

        void lockParent()
        Increments the parent lock, and will prevent parent change until unlockParent() is called.

        This method is useful if you need to prevent erroneous parent changes during specific moments of the simulation.

        You need to call unlockParent() at least the same times as you called lockParent() to be able to change the parent again.

      • lockParentRec

        void lockParentRec()
        Calls lockParent() on this entity, and then calls lockParentRec() on the parent of this entity if it is set.

      • unlockParent

        void unlockParent()
        Decrements the parent lock.

        You need to call unlockParent() at least the same times as you called lockParent() to be able to change the parent.

      • unlockParentRec

        void unlockParentRec()
        Calls unlockParent() on this entity, and then calls unlockParentRec() on the parent of this entity if it is set.

      • getConfig

        Config getConfig()
        Returns this entity's configuration as set using setConfig(Config), or null.

        This method may return null if no configuration was set for this Entity.

        Note: a configuration may be shared between more than one entity, use properties (setProperty(Object, Object)), if you want to set data for this sole instance.

        Returns:
        this entity's configuration or null if none is set
        See Also:
        getConfigRec()

      • getConfigRec

        Config getConfigRec()
        Returns a not null configuration for this entity.

        This method first tries to return this entity's configuration if it is set (ie: not null).

        If this entity has a null configuration, then this method returns the parent's configuration by calling getConfigRec() on the parent of this entity.

        If this entity has a null configuration and a null parent, then the simulator's configuration is returned.

        Unlike getConfig(), this method should not return null.

        Returns:
        a not null configuration for this entity

      • setConfig

        void setConfig(Config config)
        Updates this entity's configuration.
        Parameters:
        config - new configuration

      • getLogger

        Logger getLogger()
        Returns a Logger instance for this Entity.

        Default is to return the logger of the parent of this entity.

        If this entity has a null parent, then Logger.getGlobal() is returned.

        Returns:
        a Logger instance for this Entity

      • addEntity

        void addEntity(Entity entity)
        Adds a new children entity.
        This does not update the parent of the given entity.

        Note: You should not need to call this method, instead use EntityImpl.setParent(Entity).

        Parameters:
        entity -

      • getEntities

        List<Entity> getEntities()
        Returns a list containing all children entities. The order of these entities is not defined, and can be different from the insertion order.
        Returns:
        a list containing all children entities

      • removeEntity

        void removeEntity(Entity entity)
        Search for the given children entity and removes it.
        This does not update the parent property of the entity.

        Note: You should not need to call this method, instead use EntityImpl.setParent(Entity) with null parameter.

        Parameters:
        entity -
